forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. South southwest wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely after 10am. Mostly cloudy. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. South wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the twilight of Downtown San Francisco, a delicate curtain of clouds makes its presence felt, perfectly aligned with the evening's gentle chill. As the clock ticks past midnight, the city finds itself cloaked in a mostly cloudy embrace, with the temperature lingering around a serene 57 degrees. The breath of the South-Southwest wind carries whispers of the changing weather, its playful gusts weaving through the streets at up to 22 miles per hour, inviting the few wanderers to wrap themselves in layers.

The dawn promises a shift, where raindrops may begin their dance after 10 AM. A suggested high of 66 will ease into the afternoon's cooler embrace, nudging temperatures around 63. Those venturing outside should prepare for the possibility of rain, with a chance of 60%—a fleeting drizzle that may not soak, but rather grace the day with its soft presence. As the day unfolds, the clouds will interplay with the sun, casting a unique light over the city that will elevate even the simplest errands into charming adventures. So, choose a reliable jacket, perhaps paired with an umbrella just in case; today's activities might best revolve around taking in the cozy cafes or indulging in the artistic enclaves of the city, enjoying the warmth of a cup in hand while observing the rhythm of life as it unfolds around you.
